instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display 0.25A
threads.message:
Hi everyone.

CPU VCore present. Fan spins on then off then on and stays on full speed.
No USB activity light turns on but not blinking.

<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> - 1.69V steady

Very minor liquid on <CHIP>U1930</CHIP>  pin 6.  <CHIP>U1930</CHIP>  replaced.
The rest of the board is clean.
Mac started to boot to the system and works fine, after a few hours it started to not turn on. Just turning on after SMC reset on the keyboard.
Now I get green and orange light, fan spins goes off spins again and goes full speed.
SLP and <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is present
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> missing

Can you help me, please?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display 0.25A
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>CPU_VCCST_PWRGD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CPU_VR_READY</SIGNAL>.

I suspect accumulated crap underneath CPU; heat with quality flux.
